titles.title: A Virgin Chaste How Fair to View (easy sweet t

properties.verseOrder: v1 v2 v3 v4 v5 v6 v7

verse.name: v1
verse.lines: {lang-eng}A virgin chaste how fair to view The saints so loved to Thee kept true And spotless all the journey through Espoused to Thee alone{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: {lang-eng}With holy gems of wondrous worth And robes whose beauty not of earth Invests a bride of heavenly birth Adorned for Thee alone{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: {lang-eng}Borne as a seal Thy love's delight Upon Thine heart and arm of might Led onward in a path of light Sustained by Thee alone{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: {lang-eng}The Spirit's charge a heavenly Guide Directs the journey of the bride Each movement on the desert wide Controlled for Thee alone{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v5
verse.lines: {lang-eng}Enraptured with her glorious Head Her feet with haste the pathway tread Her heart to every rival dead Possessed by Thee alone{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v6
verse.lines: {lang-eng}With strength of heart to cherish Thee With breadth of mind Thy thoughts to see With every bridal quality Endowed for Thee alone{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v7
verse.lines: {lang-eng}In holy robes in beauty rare The fruit of loves unceasing care The bride shall soon be greeted there Presented Thine alone{/lang-eng}
